Title: Over 1,000 literary figures boycott Israeli publishers 'complicit...
Description: Israeli publishers must 'denounce Israel's genocidal apartheid regime' and 'affirm the full protected rights of the Palestinian people' to be exempt from the boycott. Sally Rooney is among the high-profile authors to sign the letter

Title: Western countries condemn Israel's ban on UNRWA, warm of worsenin...
Description: After Israel passed laws limiting UNRWA operations, the U.S. and other Western countries say denying education and welfare services to hundreds of thousands of Palestinians in the West Bank and Gaza will lead to more destabilizing violence

Description: The Hamas-run health ministry said those wounded in the strike could not receive care as doctors had been forced to evacuate the nearby Kamal Adwan Hospital

Title: Hezbollah names Naim Qassem as Hassan Nasrallah's successor in Le...
Description: Hezbollah's decision to appoint Qassem comes after Nasrallah's initial successor Hashem Safieddine was killed in an Israeli strike on the Beirut neighborhood of Dahiyeh

Title: Haaretz investigation: Intelligence operation collected informati...
Description: A fake account on Strava systematically exploited the popular fitness app to collect information about Israeli soldiers serving in sensitive bases and secret sites, including a U.S. military base. Israeli army says it is investigating

Title: Israeli soldier dies of wounds sustained in north Gaza combat
Description: Company Commander Guy Yaakov Nazari, 25, served as a company commander in the 52nd Battalion of the 401st Armored Brigade. He was wounded by an anti-tank missile in an encounter in north Gaza

Title: When the girls came back I thought I would be among the leaders ...
Description: Maayan Zin's daughters, Dafna and Ella, were released from Hamas captivity during the cease-fire in November 2023. Their father was murdered on October 7. She never imagined that so much time would pass and there would still be 101 hostages in Gaza. 'There are older people there, for over a year; maybe they're being abused and aren't eating and aren't being cared for.'

Title: Netanyahu can smell total victory – over Israel
Description: The smugness exuding from coalition lawmakers' speeches signals that by the end of the Knesset's winter session, Israel will be even less tolerant, and more racist, corrupt, and oppressive than it already is. One thing will remain unchanged: the ultra-Orthodox still won't serve in the army

Title: Netanyahu to review progress of Lebanon cease-fire talks with min...

Title: Knesset approves bills banning UN relief agency UNRWA from operat...
Description: The two bills would make it substantially more difficult for UNRWA, the agency tasked with providing education, social welfare, food and other services to millions of Palestinians, to operate in Israel, including East Jerusalem

Title: Benjamin Netanyahu is campaigning to persuade Israelis to forget ...
Description: My friend Omri Miran – a father of two young girls who was kidnapped on October 7 – remains in Gaza, while we wait for the urgency of his release to overcome the cynical political calculations of Israel's prime minister

Title: Israel at war, day 388: Israel pursuing brief cease-fire deal for...
Description: Netanyahu: Israel trying to promote small deal to release several hostages in exchange for short cease-fire in Gaza ■ Hamas reportedly willing to accept Egyptian proposal for two-day truce that would include release of four living hostages and Palestinian prisoners ■ Defense Minister Gallant: Israel is conducting the war without a compass or 'updated war goals,' proposing promotion of alternative to Hamas in Gaza ■ Palestinian Civil Emergency Service: 100,000 trapped in north Gaza without medical or food supplies ■ Here's what you need to know 388 days into the war

Title: Netanyahu says Israel pursuing brief Gaza cease-fire in exchange ...
Description: Netanyahu informed Likud members that Israel is working toward a deal based on Egypt's recent proposal, though Hamas has indicated it would only agree if the deal is used to jump-start a process that would see Israel's complete withdrawal from the Gaza Strip

Title: Palestinians say 100,000 residents trapped in Israel's north Gaza...
Description: Residents say Israeli forces were besieging shelters housing displaced families, rounding up men and pushing women and children to leave the area. Only a few families headed to southern Gaza as the majority preferred to relocate temporarily in Gaza City, fearing they could otherwise never regain access to their homes

Title: Palestinians say 100,000 residents trapped in Israel's north Gaza...
Description: Residents say Israeli forces were besieging shelters housing displaced families, rounding up men and pushing women and children to leave the area. Only a few families headed to southern Gaza as the majority preferred to relocate temporarily in Gaza City, fearing they could otherwise never regain access to their homes

Title: Ben-Gurion Airport's Terminal 1 closes its doors to international...
Description: The terminal, which briefly opened seven months after the war's start anticipating an influx in tourism, is closing due to a decrease in passenger traffic, and low-cost carriers cancelling service over security concerns. Domestic flights will continue to fly out of Terminal 1

Title: Washington Post becomes second major U.S. newspaper this week to ...
Description: The Post's decision, which was reportedly made by owner Jeff Bezos, comes days after the Los Angeles Times announced a similar decision, triggering the resignations of its editorial page editor and two other members of the editorial board

Title: Ending Israel's war in Gaza won't be enough to stop the fighting ...
Description: Lebanon doesn't want any changes to UN Security Council Resolution 1701, while Israel and the United States demand an upgrade that would let Israel monitor implementation from the air and even send troops over the border. An agreement on this doesn't appear forthcoming

Title: Ending Israel's war in Gaza won't be enough to stop the fighting ...
Description: Lebanon doesn't want any changes to UN Security Council Resolution 1701, while Israel and the United States demand an upgrade that would let Israel monitor implementation from the air and even send troops over the border. An agreement on this doesn't appear forthcoming

Title: Netanyahu seeks state funds to renovate Caesarea villa after Hezb...
Description: Despite his office denying the report, Netanyahu has previously used state funds to reinforce his personal residence. In the attack, one drone struck the residence, damaging a window and leaving a crater on the property. No one was home during the strike

Title: Sahar promised her father he wouldn't die in the tunnels. What do...
Description: Nissan Kalderon, whose brother, Ofer, was taken hostage with his two children, didn't immediately understand the need for the Hostages and Missing Families Forum. There's a country to take care of them, he thought. Today, he says openly: 'If the hostages die, Netanyahu is their murderer'

Title: Knesset committee's winter session kicks off with desperate pleas...
Description: Danny Elgarat, whose brother Itzhak is held captive in Gaza, referred to reports that say Netanyahu backed away from a framework for a hostage deal: 'A two-day cease-fire in exchange for four living hostages, and he told the Shin Bet chief – 'bring a better deal.' Is that not abandonment?'

Title: Under its fearless editor, Lebanese newspaper An-Nahar maintains ...
Description: In 2005 the editor of An-Nahar, Gebran Tueni, was assassinated. Nearly 20 years on, with the leadership of his daughter Nayla Tueni, it continues to speak out – in increasingly imaginative ways

Title: Under its fearless editor, Lebanese newspaper An-Nahar maintains ...
Description: In 2005 the editor of An-Nahar, Gebran Tueni, was assassinated. Nearly 20 years on, with the leadership of his daughter Nayla Tueni, it continues to speak out – in increasingly imaginative ways

Title: Second Gentleman Emhoff to deliver final pitch to U.S. Jews in Pi...

Title: Five Israeli soldiers killed in south Lebanon, one dies of wounds...

Title: Tony Blair says Hamas cannot rule Gaza, Israel must allow alterna...

Title: In Israel, it's closely guarded tech. In America, anyone can use ...

Title: Coalition bill seeks to bar Arab Israeli Knesset candidates, curb...
Description: The current law bars candidates and party lists that support armed struggle by enemy states or terrorist organizations against Israel from running for Knesset. The bill seeks to extend this ban to include 'lone attackers' and add the phrase 'against Israeli civilians'

Title: One killed, dozens wounded in suspected ramming attack in central...
Description: Over 30 people were wounded when a truck rammed into a busy bus stop in central Israel. The truck driver was shot dead at the scene. The motive of the incident is still unclear, and police have refrained from confirming it as terror attack

Title: One killed, dozens wounded in suspected terror ramming attack in ...
Description: Over 30 people were wounded when a truck rammed into a busy bus stop in central Israel, including a group of elderly citizens who were visiting a nearby museum. The truck driver, an Israeli citizen, was shot dead at the scene

Title: Four Israeli soldiers killed in southern Lebanon combat, IDF anno...
Description: An initial IDF probe into the event says the force was caught by surprise by three Hezbollah militants hiding in a building. The militants threw grenades and shot toward the soldiers when a fire broke out, making the structure collapse

Description: Israel may have dealt a significant blow to Iran's missile production capabilities, making it more challenging for any future Iranian missile attacks to breach Israel's defenses, one researcher says

Title: Gaza cease-fire summit begins in Qatar; Hamas to seek all hostage...
Description: IRAN: U.S. researcher said Israel's strike targeted facility associated with Tehran's former nuclear weapons program. Iran's Khamenei said attack should neither be downplayed nor exaggerated ■ GAZA: At least 30 dead in IDF strike that targeted houses in Beit Lahia, according to Palestinian media ■ LEBANON: Two people moderately, lightly wounded in Hezbollah drone strike on defense facility in northern Israel ■ HOSTAGE DEAL: Mossad chief set to attend Qatar summit on Sunday

Description: ■ Iran: A U.S. researcher told Reuters that Israel's strike targeted a facility associated with Tehran's former nuclear weapons program. Description: This renewal in negotiation is the first significant step toward a deal since Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar's killing earlier in October. Israel and the mediating countries are expected to review several proposals presented in recent weeks to rescue the stalled negotiations

Title: Iran is striving for regional strategic achievements, not an exch...
Description: Iran's attempts to position itself as an influential regional power, and not just a focus of threats and confrontation, could have implications for the way it acts militarily against Israel – and affect its ability to contribute to a solution to the war in Lebanon and Gaza

Title: Israeli army denies military burial to reserve airman who committ...
Description: Maj. (res.) Asaf Dagan was in reserve service a few weeks before he killed himself; his family says he had post-traumatic stress disorder as a result of his military service and is refusing to bury him for now

Title: Israel demonstrates its long-range strike capability by hitting I...
Description: Iran is minimizing the magnitude of the blow it has incurred, which could testify to a desire to end the rounds of tit-for-tat. The threat from Iran is convenient for Netanyahu, who can distract attention from the trap in which Israel finds itself stuck in Lebanon and Gaza

Title: Israel at war, day 386: Israel strikes Iran's military sites in r...
Description: The IDF said it launched its retaliatory attack against Iran, targeting military sites; Iranian media: Four Iranian soldiers were killed ■ IDF says humanitarian zone in Al-Mawasi in south Gaza to be expanded ■ IDF: Israel's air force struck over 70 Hezbollah 'terror targets' in Lebanon ■ Palestinian Health Ministry: Man, 29, killed by IDF fire in West Bank; IDF says he was a Hamas operative planning an attack ■ Here's what you need to know 386 days into the war

Title: Thousands protest across Israel for hostage release deal on eve o...
Description: Rallies calling for a deal that would release the hostages held in Gaza are being held in various locations across Israel, ahead of a Qatar summit on Sunday where negotiations will renew. Haifa will not see a protest for the fifth consecutive week due to Home Front Command restrictions

Title: Regional escalation would impose a death sentence on our loved o...
Description: Rallies calling for a deal that would release the hostages held in Gaza will be held in various locations across Israel, ahead of a Qatar summit on Sunday where negotiations will renew. Haifa will not see a protest for the fifth consecutive week due to Home Front Command restrictions

Title: Every day I wake up and don't understand how I'm still in the sa...
Description: Many people have told Ruty Strom to engage in activities that would distract her from the fact that two of her sons have been held in Gaza for a year, but she stresses that Yair and Eitan 'are always with me... before I go to bed I look at their picture, and feel that they are looking back at me'

Title: U.S. is pushing for a deal to release a few Israeli hostages in e...
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken described the proposal as an attempt to gauge Hamas' seriousness for a broader deal, according to hostages' families who met with him. Given that Hamas' position is still unclear, the proposal has yet to be put to a formal vote in Israel

Title: What frightens Ezra Klein most about Israel becoming a pariah sta...
Description: After the 2014 Gaza war, U.S. journalist Ezra Klein took a 'personal break' from reporting on Israel-Palestine. A decade later he is one of the most influential voices on the conflict. In an interview with Haaretz, he discusses how October 7 're-confronted' him with Israel's impact on Diaspora Jews and why people who still think of the Jewish state as a democracy are 'delusional'

Title: What frightens Ezra Klein most about Israel becoming a pariah sta...
Description: After the 2014 Gaza war, U.S. journalist Ezra Klein took a 'personal break' from reporting on Israel-Palestine. A decade later he is one of the most influential voices on the conflict. In an interview with Haaretz, he discusses how October 7 're-confronted' him with Israel's impact on Diaspora Jews and why people who still think of the Jewish state as a democracy are 'delusional'

Title: 11-year-old Palestinian boy shot and killed in West Bank by IDF
Description: In footage of the incident, the boy is seen throwing stones at a military vehicle. In response to the incident, the IDF said forces fired at suspects who 'blocked roads and threw stones at troops' during an operation in the area, adding that the incident is being reviewed

Title: Israeli army investigating killing of 11-year-old boy by IDF fire...
Description: In footage of the incident, the boy is seen throwing stones at a military vehicle. In response t the incident, the IDF said forces fired at suspects who 'blocked roads and threw stones at troops' during an operation in the area

Title: At the beginning, it was shock. What's a hostage anyway?'
Description: I have gone to the Knesset several times,' Sigi Cohen, mother of Elia Cohen, who was abducted to Gaza from the Nova music festival, says. 'Unfortunately, I felt that what I was saying was falling on deaf ears. I found myself as an emissary for unity. We need the people with us'

Title: Close to 'Mission Accomplished' in Lebanon, the IDF is just waiti...
Description: Hezbollah has been hit harder than expected, but intelligence experts are certain it will start rebuilding immediately ■ Efforts to reach political agreement in Lebanon must admit that the previous arrangement was never really implemented ■ It is hard to disconnect IDF operations in Gaza with the radical right's dangerous resettlement plan

Title: Any sane, responsible leader would try to end the war. Not Netany...
Description: When the Israeli prime minister talks about 'revival,' there is only one thing on his mind ■ The idea of resettling the Gaza Strip is well on the way to being normalized ■ Israel's housing minister, the poster boy for parasitism, has set a new world record in chutzpah

Title: Rockets fired from Lebanon trigger sirens in central Israel; IDF ...
Description: GAZA: At least 74 killed in last day, Gaza Health Ministry says ■ LEBANON: IDF reportedly carries out large-scale strikes in Lebanon's Tyre hours after telling residents in parts of city to evacuate north ■ HOSTAGE DEAL: Biden administration pushing for limited cease-fire deal to release some hostages

Title: Rockets fired from Lebanon trigger sirens in Tel Aviv, across cen...
Description: GAZA: At least 74 killed in last day, Gaza Health Ministry says ■ LEBANON: IDF reportedly carries out large-scale strikes in Lebanon's Tyre hours after telling residents in parts of city to evacuate north ■ HOSTAGE DEAL: Biden administration pushing for limited cease-fire deal to release some hostages

Title: Barrage of 25 rockets fired at Haifa suburbs, Acre in north Israe...
Description: GAZA: At least 74 killed in last day, Gaza Health Ministry says ■ LEBANON: IDF reportedly carries out large-scale strikes in Lebanon's Tyre hours after telling residents in parts of city to evacuate north ■ ISRAEL: Hezbollah launched rockets at central Israel two days in a row ■ HOSTAGE DEAL: Biden administration pushing for limited cease-fire deal to release some hostages, Blinken in Israel for Middle East tour

Title: IDF tells some residents of Lebanon's Tyre to evacuate; One wound...
Description: GAZA: IDF calls on north Gaza residents of Beit Lahia to evacuate ■ LEBANON: IDF tells residents in parts of Lebanon's Tyre to evacuate north ■ ISRAEL: Hezbollah launched rockets at central Israel two days in a row ■ HOSTAGE DEAL: Blinken in Israel for Middle East tour amid push to restart cease-fire/hostage release talks

Title: Report: Trump told aides he needs 'the kind of generals that Hitl...
Description: A spokesman for the Republican presidential nominee denied Trump made the statements

Title: IDF: Hezbollah official expected to be group's next leader killed...
Description: Hashem Safieddine, who joined Hezbollah at its inception and headed its executive council, was marked as Nasrallah's successor in 2008. The Israeli military said he was killed in a strike three weeks ago

Title: As Israel readies to strike Iran, the Pentagon spills its ally's ...
Description: The two U.S. intelligence documents that were made public last weekend provide a unique and unprecedentedly deep glimpse into the IDF's clandestine activity - and the very close surveillance by the Americans of its friend and ally

Title: Israeli Jews very rarely agreed to spy on behalf of Israel's wors...
Description: But in recent years, and especially in the last year of war, many Israelis are depressed because they don't see an end to Netanyahu's belligerent policies; the economy is deteriorating and the government doesn't offer hope to its citizens. All these are fertile ground for the cultivation of spies

Title: After a high-profile launch, 'The Bibi Files' will stream exclusi...
Description: The film includes leaked documentation from investigations conducted against Netanyahu between 2016 and 2018. 'Even though Israel is in the papers every day, all day, nobody wanted to touch this film,' the film's director said about the decision to distribute it with a new, minor platform

Title: Blinken urges Israel to increase humanitarian aid to northern Gaz...
Description: After meeting with Netanyahu, the State Department emphasized that Israel must ensure aid 'reaches civilians across Gaza.' Sources say the cabinet is considering coordinating aid convoys with private security services, aiming to resolve the dispute with the U.S. government

Title: Israeli channel sued for 'emotional distress' after airing graphi...

Title: IDF names three Israeli soldiers killed in separate incidents

Title: Israeli airstrikes destroy Beirut buildings, Health Ministry: 63 ...
Description: Late on Monday, an Israeli airstrike destroyed several buildings in Beirut, across the street from the country's largest public hospital, killing 18 people and wounding at least 60 others. On Tuesday, the IDF leveled a building that it said housed Hezbollah facilities, with no immediate report of casualties

Title: Israel confirms: Hezbollah drone struck Netanyahu's private resid...
Description: Hezbollah launched three drones at Netanyahu's home in Caesarea. Two were intercepted by the Iron Dome, while one struck the bedroom window, creating a gaping hole in the side of the house and causing additional damage. Netanyahu and his wife were not at home during the attack

Description: Hezbollah launched three drones at Netanyahu's home in Caesarea. Two were intercepted by the Iron Dome, while one struck the bedroom window, creating a gaping hole in the side of the house and causing additional damage. Netanyahu and his wife were not at home during the attack

Title: They only understand force': The deadly racism behind Israel's p...

Title: Thousands attend funeral of Druze armored brigade commander
Description: Col. (res.) Ehsan Daxa, the commander of the 401st Armored Brigade, was laid to rest in Daliat al-Carmel. The town's mayor hailed him as a 'proud Druze officer' – and called to abolish the so-called nation-state law

Title: Hebrew Israelites mourn their first combat death
Description: Hundreds attended the funeral of Sgt. Elishai Young, 19, who was killed in Gaza. He was born and educated in Israel, drafted for combat service and killed in the war, but he isn't a citizen of Israel but a permanent resident. 'We share the same fate – everyone should get the same conditions,' says a relative

Description: At a Sukkot-themed gathering near the Gaza border, settlers and far-right leaders outlined plans to reestablish Jewish settlements in the Strip 'within a year.'
